title: Sri Lanka extends free visa for Russian, Ukrainian tourists for another 3 months
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet has approved to further extend free visas by another three months to Ukrainian and Russian tourists currently in the island nation, a government spokesman said on Tuesday, as fighting continues in the Eastern European country amid talks.

Visa for tourists from both countries was initially extended on February 28 for two months free of charge. The cabinet has decided to extend it further since the crisis between the two countries has not yet subsided.
Russia and Ukraine tourists had been accounting for nearly a quarter of Sri Lanka’s tourist arrivals before the war started, Tourism Ministry statistics show.
According to data issued by the government officials on March 01, the visa extension will apply to 11,463 Russians and 3,993 Ukrainians who are currently in Sri Lanka.
